ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Looking for some volunteers
ygData.msgSnippet: Andrew, I don t mind helping you out.  If you want, send me an email to wulftech@earthlink.net and we can set up details from there.  I don t think
ygData.messageBody:
Andrew,

I don't mind helping you out. If you want, send me an email to
wulftech@... and we can set up details from there. I don't think
compensation's necessary.

Wulfric






----- Original Message -----
From: haywoodandrew
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 08, 2003 12:47 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Looking for some volunteers


Hi all,

This is an odd request, but I am looking for some Everquest players that
wouldn't mind being interviewed either by IM, phone, or if practical in
person. I
am a graduate student at the Institute of Design at Illinois Institute of
Technology in Chicago. For one of my classes, entitled Observing Users, we
have to study a product and its users. Our group chose Everquest because we
think that it is very interesting and complex. As a retired online gamer I
know
how much fun and involving the games can be. In fact, I am very tempted to
jump into Everquest, but I am worried that I may lose concentration on my
studies. If anyone is willing to devote a little of their time to helping us
out we
would really appreciate it. Unfortunately, we are poor grad students and
will
not be able to compensate anyone who helps us out, but we will very very
thankful. Thanks

Andrew Haywood
